intro: Aeschynomene bracteolaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by narrow, elongated pods containing several seeds. It is adapted to grow in dry, disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine or as a forage plant. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and potential agricultural applications.
